articles.author: Trish Bendix
articles.title: Late Night Taken Aback as Trump Says He Likes to Obey the Law
articles.description: After the president said he wouldn’t order attacks on Iranian cultural sites, Trevor Noah said he made obeying international law sound like “an optional topping at Chipotle.”
articles.content:
No, you have to obey the law. Trump makes the law sound like its an optional topping at Chipotle. [Expletive], its the Geneva Convention, not pico de gallo. TREVOR NOAH
[As Trump] I like to obey the law, just ask Paul Manafort or Michael Cohen. If they ever … [+1041 chars]

articles.author: Mike Ives
articles.title: Iran, Boeing, Carlos Ghosn: Your Wednesday Briefing
articles.description: Here’s what you need to know.
articles.content:
Instead of canceling him, Frances literary elite spent years showering him with acclaim.
But a new book in which Vanessa Springora, now 47 and the head of a publishing company, recounts being seduced by the famous writer when she was 14 has fueled an intense… [+1532 chars]

articles.author: Jochen Bittner
articles.title: The Tragedy of Germany’s Energy Experiment
articles.description: The country is moving beyond nuclear power. But at what cost?
articles.content: The plan risks more than a shortfall in supply. It could also prevent the country from dealing with climate change. By shutting down nuclear plants faster than those for coal, Germany may consign itself to dependence on fossil fuels, and all the damage to the… [+2277 chars]

articles.author: Heather Murphy
articles.title: Los Angeles Officers Suspended After Boy Is Wrongly Labeled a Gang Member
articles.description: A mother’s concerns unleashed an investigation into whether an elite police unit was falsifying records.
articles.content: Ms. Ochoa said the recent case in the San Fernando Valley underscored that increased regulations alone could not keep California residents from being wrongly identified as gang members. No matter how good the standards for whats required to put someone in the… [+1280 chars]

articles.author: The New York Times
articles.title: Iran ‘Concludes’ Missile Attacks, Minister Says: Live Updates
articles.description: In a tweet, President Trump suggested that damages and casualties sustained by American forces were minimal. But he also said the assessment of damages was ongoing.
articles.content:
Iranian news media reported the attacks began hours after the remains of General Suleimani were returned to his hometown in Iran for burial.
Hossein Soleimani, the editor in chief of Mashregh, the main Revolutionary Guards news website, said that more than 3… [+677 chars]

articles.author: Carlos Tejada
articles.title: Oil Jumps and Stocks Fall as Markets Digest Iran Attack
articles.description: Turmoil moderates after Tehran signals it may not seek further reprisals for U.S. ordered killing last week of a top military leader.
articles.content:
HONG KONG Oil prices rose and stocks fell as Asian markets began trading on Wednesday, following news that Iran had launched missiles at American forces based in Iraq. 
Markets concerns eased later in the day as Iran hinted that it would not take hostilities… [+638 chars]

articles.author: Ed Shanahan
articles.title: Concrete Mixer, Sanitation Truck and Bus Kill 3 N.Y.C. Pedestrians
articles.description: One of those struck was a 10-year-old boy. The fatalities brought the pedestrian death toll to five in the new year.
articles.content:
Video footage shot by a passer-by shows the woman, plastic bag in one hand and cane in the other, walking slowly across the avenue in front of the truck, which is waiting behind another vehicle at a red light beneath the elevated D train tracks.
The woman pa… [+1334 chars]

articles.author: Michael Paulson
articles.title: ‘Sing Street’ to Bring Irish Romance and ’80s Sounds to Broadway
articles.description: The new musical, now wrapping up an Off Broadway run, will open at the Lyceum Theater in April.
articles.content:
The Sing Street score is made up of nine songs written for the movie by Carney and Gary Clark (including one that was cut from the film), as well as fragments of 80s pop songs (including Rio, a Duran Duran song also used in the film).
The Off Broadway produc… [+933 chars]

articles.author: Gia Kourlas
articles.title: Gibney Receives Grant to Transform Into a Repertory Company
articles.description: Gina Gibney says she sees an “urgent need” for a repertory group along the lines of Nederlands Dans Theater and Ballet BC.
articles.content: The choreographer and entrepreneur Gina Gibney announced on Wednesday that her dance company is the recipient of a $2 million gift, which is to be used for its reinvention as a commission-based repertory group. The money, which comes from Andrew A. Davis, a t… [+1242 chars]

articles.author: The New York Times
articles.title: What to Expect as Carlos Ghosn Speaks
articles.description: The fugitive ex-Nissan chairman is to hold a news conference in Beirut, in his first public comments about why (and maybe how) he fled Japan.
articles.content: Born in Brazil and raised in Lebanon, Mr. Ghosn attended some of Frances best schools, the Lycée Saint-Louis and the École Polytechnique. He started his career at the tire maker Michelin and became head of the companys North American operations. He lived in G… [+1033 chars]
